oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Cumberland River and Shelby Street Bridge, c.1980s
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of the Shelby Street Bridge over the Cumberland River, with the General Jackson Showboat underneath, circa 1980s. The Nashville Bridge Company building is visible on the left. Completed in 1909 and spanning the Cumberland River to link East Nashville to the downtown area, the Shelby Street Bridge was considered very innovative, with concrete trusses making a new underneath support system. Originally known as the Sparkman Street Bridge, it is now known as the John Seigenthaler Pedestrian Bridge. The bridge was added to the National Register of Historic Places in 1986, and it was later reopened after extensive renovations as a pedestrian walkway in 2003. Photographed by the Nashville Housing Authority. Forms part of the MDHA Photograph Collection. 1 photograph : b & w.
